intro: Erigeron wyomingensis, commonly known as Wyoming fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer and early fall. Wyoming fleabane is often found in arid regions and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
